item.title: singly linked list
item.author: sumit
item.description: introduction: Single linked list is a linear data structure. Itâ€™s elements are not stored in contiguous memory location like arrays. it is slightly different from array. it made by the nodes, each nodes consist a data and the address of the next node and each nodes are linked using pointers. creation of node To create a new node in C++, you will need to define a structure or class that represents a node, and then create an instance of that structure or class.
